website_summaries.verdict: It shares a lot of qualities with other top performers, and it costs about half the price. Ideal for home users with small to medium hedge-trimming needs.
pros: 24-inch dual-action blade provides more cutting power and less vibration
40-volt battery can trim 6,000 feet on one charge
Comfortable grip supports all trimming positions
cons: Separate battery charger and storage guard purchase may be required

website_summaries.verdict: A powerful, lightweight, cordless trimmer that is easy to operate. It has a 24-inch blade and is built to last.
pros: Combining the large blade, the 40-volt battery, and the 0.75-inch cutting capacity, this trimmer can get even the big jobs done quickly
Features a wraparound front handle so you can easily do both horizontal and vertical trimming
The fast charger can fully recharge the batteries in under an hour
cons: A few customers noticed some durability issues after only 2 years of service

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye to old-fashion hedge clippers
customer_reviews.text: I initially had some trepidation about a battery powered cutting tool. Not anymore. I used this trimmer for 2 hours before the battery ran out. It required less than an hour to recharge. I am still aghast as to how well it performed in cutting branches up to big finger size thickness. It is also remarkably light for its power. I use one hand to get to the high branches. I am trying to convince my wife, who uses old fashion hedge clippers, that she would save hours of time, as this instrument is light enough for the fairer sex to use. Sorry if this sounds sexist rather than informative.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis F.

customer_reviews.title: Done with Black & Decker
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this July 23, 2017......it died July 12th 2018.....As it was still under warranty I took it to the local Black & Decker authorized service center. They said they don’t service battery powered tools and gave me the address of a service center another 10 miles away. I’m not driving there and certainly not paying to ship it there so in the trash it went. I won’t be buying anymore B&D products.
customer_reviews.author: Foomanchoo

customer_reviews.title: Five uses and burnt out and died.
customer_reviews.text: I got this a year ago. Used it twice during summer/fall to trim a 30'x2' privet hedge. Used it twice this spring/summer on same hedge. Each time worked great. Cut well, lightweight, easy to use. This time, the 5th time used, it started struggling and the next thing smoke started pouring out and it burnt out. Five uses and dead? At $115 it isn't a disposable tool. Lousy quality.
customer_reviews.author: JMForester

customer_reviews.title: Unusual Dissatisfaction.
customer_reviews.text: Worked this three times and noticed that the shearing blades started to clatter louder. Then after another use I noticed the odor of the motor over-heating so I stopped using it. Now.....not please with this as the motor still has a burnt smell when you use it and that clattering sounds like something has gotten worse. I have nearly ten portable B&D items and this is the first time I've seen a quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: Billy T. Budd

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!! Overheat and fire hazard!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in summer 2016 for new house. Everything worked great until it start overheat and smoke. For $115 only last less than 2 1/2 years with 4 times usage a year this is not that great but waste of money!!! Called Black+Decker CS and I'll say Black+Decker got one of the worst CS!!! Updated information: I contacted Black+Decker again. This time I was told to contact Amazon, place I purchased from. Well I contacted Amazon and was told contact manufacturer. At the end I was more confused than ever...
customer_reviews.author: HCC

customer_reviews.title: One of the better hedge clippers for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomics excellent. Noise level loud. Battery charge level, normal charge with the battery supplied, is about 30 minutes for light duty. Do not use for stems or limbs exceeding 6.35 mm or 1/4 inch in diameter. Any larger and the blade teeth may bend or distort on the cutter bar rendering your device a battery powered paper weigh. Keep clean to extend user life. Estimated user life about 400-600 hours operation MTBF, which is actually rather good for this type of product. That should be about 5 years "average" use. .
customer_reviews.author: Tested and evaluated

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Bought this bc I needed something to chop down my bamboo problem and the chainsaw wasn't doing too good of a job and I must say, this thing is a beast! I was swinging away and bamboo were just dropping everywhere! I also used it to trim the little twigs that were hanging from this one tree in my backyard and it handled that with ease too! Def recommend to add this to your home garden tool supply!
customer_reviews.author: Huey Le

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tool....
customer_reviews.text: For too many years I trimmed hedges the old fashioned way....chopping them by hand. Finally I had enough and decided to look into a battery powered trimmer. I'm a homeowner and have no need for commercial grade tools, so after reading reviews finally chose this one. I couldn't be more pleased. The price was right, the free shipping quick, and the performance fantastic. The trimmer arrived fully assembled and the battery charge was very quick; about 45 minutes. What used to take me several hours of trimming by hand was reduced to under an hour, and the trimmer never lost power. I highly recommend this to any home owner.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: I purchased 3 of these...
customer_reviews.text: Please....buy a heavy duty gas one instead. That was the choice I had to make: Buy a heavy duty metal gas trimmer, or three plastic battery ones for the same price. If I bought only one of these and it burned out, I would have thought maybe it was a fluke. I thought, hey if these reviews are true about the motors burning out, I will still have two more. Yeah... I have no more. All three smoked after about a week of use. Maybe because my hedges are thick evergreen hedges???
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Powerful tool
customer_reviews.text: I used to have the 20 volt Black and Decker which lasted for a LONG time. But had to get a new one and I couldn't find the 20 v so bought the 40 Vold ... It is way more powerful than the old (dead) one and cut my time down considerably. It's a little heavier, but not heavy in the normal sense. I'm a 70 year old female and I trimmed with the best of them today. First use. Hope it lasts. If it does, I'll be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This thing burned out on me again, I used it for less then 30mins and it started to smoked, it came out from the motor is my guess, now it's not working anymore. THIS IS THE SECOND ONE THAT BURNED OUT! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!.
customer_reviews.author: anusone d.

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately for Black & Decker it's not a very good one. It worked for about a season before ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally getting around to giving this product a review. Unfortunately for Black & Decker it's not a very good one. It worked for about a season before intermittently stopping on its own and then it died. I wasn't cutting anything significant at the time of its death, very disappointed because I had to use my old hedge trimmers to finish the project. The good news is it gave me a good workout.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby McKernie

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cord!  This works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have the string trimmer (which works great!) so I bought this to get an extra battery while avoiding the specter of future extension cord repairs (I always manage to slice a foot or two off my cord every year!). I used to trim some forsythia with branches up to about 1/4” diameter with no issues. The cutting bar is as long as my corded hedge trimmer! The unit is light weight and easy to maneuver. The boot, I no longer need to be paranoid about cutting my extension cords!
customer_reviews.author: LanceD

customer_reviews.title: 2 Year Review- Excellent Trimmers!
customer_reviews.text: Weve had these hedge trimmers for almost 3 years now. In one word they are excellent. Through hard use they have held up well, are still sharp and the battery still holds a full charge. We have 5 acres on the WA coast and the forests here are THICK. These trimmers blaze through everything from inch-thick blackberries to vining maple shoots. This trimmer and the b+d 40 volt chainsaw are my go-to tools for around the property. Lightly spray the trimmer blades with lube before each use and it will last you for years. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Evergreen State

customer_reviews.title: Almost five years of abuse...
customer_reviews.text: ...with only some wd40 and amateur hand sharpening. I don't have a lot of hedge but I use it much for grass trimming in some areas in beds. It is much more even and less trauma in these close areas versus a string trimmer. A great tool. I also have the 40v B&D leaf blower and string trimmer all same age and still doing the job. I am blessed and can afford to upgrade but this mess just keeps on working.

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: I really like mine. Make sure you purchase the one with the battery and charger. I will never have to use an extension cord or have to mix gas again. It has plenty of power and battery length to do the job. It cuts some pretty thick limbs. It is fairly light, but if you have to hold it out with one hand, it does get tiring, fast. I wouldn't let a child use it, because it would cut an extremity. I would purchase this hedge trimmer again in a second. Not sure why i waited so long.
customer_reviews.author: wader

customer_reviews.title: Hard working and efficient trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it is battery operated and I don't have to worry about a cord or electrical source. I have yet to exhaust the battery in a single using. It easily trims shrubs such as spirea and boxwood and its size makes short work of the job. I have also used it to trim large, thick clumps of native grasses in the spring. The only thing I find a little difficult is trimming branches that touch the ground without getting the blade in the soil. I usually go back with a small tool to get what I missed. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Buxton

customer_reviews.title: Multipurpose trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: Hedge trimmer slash electric fence trimmer! Hate tools with only one purpose. Farm jobs require dependable tools, battery life is great, by the time the battery wears out I am ready for a break! This has plenty of power for anything I have thrown at it, I have tried gas trimmers and they usually last a year and change then they turn into a fight so I went with a battery powered trimmer. So far I am very happy with purchase, this is really an inexpensive way to trim under electric fence for cows, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Farmer George

customer_reviews.title: The device looked good and worked OK for the first season
customer_reviews.text: The device looked good and worked OK for the first season, (2016), but this year it start having troubles, turning weak and finnally it stop and doesn't work anymore. It's incredible, when you don't used it more than 30 times, around 30 min., (not continuous), every time, it means you got a piece of junk. I'm trying to contact someone who can solve this problem: AMAZON ?... Black & Decker ?... the SELLER ?...
customer_reviews.author: marco

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This came fast and worked great! As a woman I wanted something light but powerful enough to trim all my shrubs. This worked great and now I don’t need to hire guys to do it for me! This is saving me money plus I can trim everything just the way I want it done!
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: This was the worst purchase that I ever made
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst purchase that I ever made. When the trimmer was new and fully charged, it would only trim for about 15-20 minutes and it was dead. I got practically no use out of it. When I tried to charge it up several months later the charger just burned out. No good at all and I always thought highly of black and decker. Maybe this was just a flaw in the manufacture of this particular one.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Wall

customer_reviews.title: 3rd TIME TO BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I use this on everything in the yard - hedges, vines, pruning shrubs, etc. I absolutely love it. Sometimes I get a little too ambitious with it on a larger branch that it can’t handle, but clearing it is a breeze. This is my third one, I've purchased. Using it at least four or more times a week (we have acreage), the motor lasts about a year for me. I will continue to replace it with the same, because it is so very convenient, easy to handle, lightweight, and powerful enough for my needs. Even my two neighbors have purchased these upon my recommendations and love them.
customer_reviews.author: TikiFin

customer_reviews.title: Quit and it was less than 60 days old
customer_reviews.text: We bought this hedge trimmer based on the reviews, it quit after it was 60 days old, we only used it a half dozen times. To make matters worse, I reached out to Black and Decker via their website last week to get information and they don't have a phone number, you have to fill out an online form! I filled it out the form last week and I have not heard anything. I have hedging I need to do and now I have a new hedge trimmer that doesn't work. A lot of good a 2 year warranty does if you can't find out how to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sam Rindskopf

customer_reviews.title: I’d Give it Zero Stars If I Could
customer_reviews.text: As far as I’m concerned, this is the last Black & Decker product I will purchase. To be fair, While it worked, it was a great trimmer... but come -on guys, I had it 9 months, used it 3 times and it’s broke... “kaput”. The gear spindle that drives the reciprocating blades broke and that’s its demise. Unfortunately my product return time has elapsed and I’m $109.00 out of pocket. Having taken it apart and surveyed the trimmer’s guts, I can guarantee you that it’s a piece of cheap Chinese Communist junk. My advice..... don’t buy anything made in China and that likely means all B&D products.
customer_reviews.author: NC Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works for about a year
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit after the first only lasted one year and I took good care of that one (cleaing the blades after each use) so my fingers are crossed. When it does work, it does a good job and has plenty of power and the battery seems to last. Update; after 1 season this unit crapped out like the last unit.. hit the ON button and a spot of smoke comes out and the unit beeps and it is finished. Black and Decker did replace one trimmer under its 2 year warranty. Both were homeowner used for light work for about 2 or 3 times a year.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Good while it worked but died after only 3 uses - luckily good warranty service
customer_reviews.text: Bought it last summer. Used it for the first time in the fall and really loved it. Used it for the second time in the spring. It would suddenly stop. Pulling the battery out and back in would get it working again. On the third use this summer, it simply died and would not start at all. Batteries are okay as I used the same batteries for other tools. Update - Upgraded from 1 star to 3 stars for good warranty service. I brought it to the service center and they replaced it with a brand new one, which has two years of warranty. Hopefully this new one will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Electric Motor Prone to Failure - Works great till then.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for nine months then the motor failed (started to work intermittently then completely stopped working - battery was not the problem) Nearest listed warranty service center for B&D does not do work on cordless devices. Closest B&D Factory Service center is 90 miles away through heavy traffic. I'm trashing this one and will buy another - hate to waste my investment on 40V Batteries so soon. From all the other reviews looks like the motor is the weak link in this tool. Tired to buy a replacement motor but B&D does not offer the motor as a replacement part.
customer_reviews.author: Transworld

customer_reviews.title: Very nice trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Love this trimmer! I am an older woman who needed a trimmer that I could handle and still have it do a great job. Works just like advertised and I am extremely happy with it. Battery life is great,I have hedges along the front of my yard and have been able to trim all before battery dies. Well made would recommend to anyone buying for personal yard use.
customer_reviews.author: mtdogfish

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am an over 70 year old woman, weighing 115 lbs who decided to attempt to do her own hedge trimming. I had a small trimmer that was not heavy duty enough to get the job done so ordered this and wow. Its not so heavy that I can't control it but powerful enough to cut through small branches when needed. Do it yourself and save money!
customer_reviews.author: Lindylu

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I had an electric hedge-trimmer, but I hated wrestling with the electrical cord, and I cut through it twice! Enough was enough. This new baby is lightweight, easy to use, and runs slower so it seems less dangerous. No problems with it. It uses very little battery and charges quickly. I should have bought this one first. Now it's fun to trim hedges and the results are magnificent, if I say so myself: My yard never looked better. No, I don't work for Black & Decker, but it does sound like it, I admit. I'm just telling it like it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Muncy

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Use and Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: My top two choices were the B&D and a Dewalt (for twice the cost). The cost and reviews for this B&D (LHT2436) were very good so I bought it. Unboxing, charging the battery and putting it to use was very easy. Trimming was a lot easier and faster. Previously, I had an electric trimmer. Getting out the extension cord, finding a plug, and carefully maneuvering to NOT cut the cord was a pain. I did all the trimming in about half the time as it took with the electric trimmer. Also, it is not very heavy. I highly recommend it. I
customer_reviews.author: KC Review

customer_reviews.title: 40 V battery = longer life
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 65 years old and has used lots of trimmers but never a 40 Volt electric. After using is at the church trimming the bushes there, he did't use up one battery. He came home and started using it on our driveway which is about 9/10 of a mile and finally used up the battery. He came in and told me that he loves this hedge trimmer and that it was long enough to cut an entire hedge across the top. He uses it at least 2 times a week. He goes outside to fine something that he can cut with it.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Surprised to see the positive reviews for an item that would not operate for longer than two weeks. Trimmer worked well for smaller items and battery lasted long although after several uses, it started to become louder and louder. The gears sounded as if they were not connecting although the blades were still engaged. Soon thereafter, the blades stopped working altogether. Took it apart to see if the gears had slipped out of alignment but that was not the issue. I may have gotten a defective unit or these are not designed for heavy use. Either way, I would not recommend the purchase as longevity and durability is in question.
customer_reviews.author: E C

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I didn't even realize cordless hedge trimmers we're a thing, and I hate doing trimwork because it sucks dragging a long ass electric cord around, the constant searching for outlets, or not doing trim work at all because there isn't a cord long enough for those bushes in the back 40. This little guy is powerful! I only used it for about 30 min, but it was as powerful as a corded trimmer, and I got the work done in half the time. If you hate trimming bushes like I do, but you have to get it done, I'd recommend this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Maybelle

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting battery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my parents who were tired of charging their existing one every 1.5-2 hours. My mom said she could not believe they trimmed bushes and trees all day and it didn't die on them-plus it was very easy to handle and lighter than their existing one. Very satisfied customers who are typically hard to please.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply an amazing clipper! I have over 100' of hedge to ...
customer_reviews.text: Simply an amazing clipper! I have over 100' of hedge to cut and about 50 smaller bushes to trim in my front yard. I did all of this trimming on one charge and still had battery reserve. While none of the cutting was really heavy work, this clipper cut through it like a hot knife through warm butter. It's light weight and there's no cord to mess with! Really makes the job quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, yet reasonably powerful
customer_reviews.text: Use this for routine trimming/shaping of our boxwood hedges. Much easier to use for this purpose than my Echo gas-powered hedge trimmer. Still use the Echo for more demanding applications, such as clearing light brush. Lightweight, convenient, and powerful (for a cordless electrical tool). Great buy if you need a hedge trimmer and you already own 36v/40v Black & Decker battery packs. I can trim/shape approximately 60 linear feet of hedges on a single charge, but YMMV depending on the capacity/status of your battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: EliDeuce

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: WOW, I have never used a trimmer so light weight, powerful, and easy to use. I borrowed someone's battery operated trimmer one time and could not believe how well it performed. I came home, did some research and found this trimmer. It was better quality, cheaper in price, and was given higher reviews. I am very happy with it. I can trim all my hedges in 1/4 of the time and I am not exhausted when I'm finished. The battery and myself still have energy left over. Keep up the good work!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Dorr

customer_reviews.title: this product breaks after less than one year
customer_reviews.text: we bought one in 2017. in 2018 , it broke ans was replaced under the one year warranty. it broke again in 2019, less than one year after replacement but after the one year original purchase. it does the job initially but needs to be thrown out after 10 months. The pictures shows the dead bodies of 3 years of ownership. We buy another brand from now on
customer_reviews.author: beatrice

customer_reviews.title: Ran hot & battery popped out while using
customer_reviews.text: I work as a professional gardener and wanted a lightweight option for the hundreds of shrubs I trim each month. The blades cut well, however-The trimmer handle became very hot as it was running & the battery popped out repeatedly during use.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: A big improvement over my old corded hedge trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once, so this is an early review, but so far I am very pleased. It is much easier to use than my corded unit. Seems to be well balanced and a perfect length for my needs. It seems easy to make my hedges look professionally cared for. I'm using it with the 40V battery that came with my string trimmer, so that saves both money and resources. Too early to judge reliability, but with only 100 feet or so of small hedges it should have a long and happy life. Battery power seems to be the way to go. Just added an EGO mower this year and am happy to be phasing out gas powered tools.
customer_reviews.author: SilverstreakM

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Good battery life. Sharp and works well.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It's super sharp. Can cut through easily. If you are a first time user, pls be very very careful. You wanna move first then cut. Don't cut and keep moving, a little trip can cast you a lot. Keep kids and pets away while using. This one has a good battery life and is about 7 pounds. Cheaper than gas ones but I'm sure gas ones are a lot effective but for a battery based hedge trimmer, this one rules. My porch looks like never before. Extremely please with this.
customer_reviews.author: Venky

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product By Black Decker
customer_reviews.text: It is terrible product by Black Decker . I bought last year and never used . Now it was time to use and it lasted for me only 30 minutes of work and smoke and smelling burn came out . Please don't waste your money to buy a piece of crab .
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I love it..
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was available 10 years ago when I fist bought an electric one. Luckily, my electric one failed and I had to buy a new one. Now that I have been using it for two years I can say that it is worth every penny. One battery lasts through a 160' long hedge cutting job. It takes me an hour to do it and a singe battery is enough to do the job. 40V runs strong, so I bought a lawn trimmer so now I have two batteries, two tools and enough battery power to do the job from the start to the finish. The battery charges quickly and last long.I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well
customer_reviews.text: Light, easy to hold and maneuver securely, cuts bushes, tree branches, and large grasses well. Feels safe, which is surely important. I'm 69 years old and I do not become extremely sore from using it- the way I did with manual shears. It's attractive. Instructions for removal of the battery were not at all clear- but finally figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light, easy to use...
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this especially after using a corded trimmer. This is very light, cuts great and is easy to use. Batterlasts very long for a 20v. And seeing you only trim once in a while two batteries is more than enough. But its always nice to have a spare.
customer_reviews.author: john f

customer_reviews.title: The only way to go!
customer_reviews.text: Why would you ever use another tool with a cord? I LOVE THIS TRIMMER! I was able to trim over 20 bushes in my yard and it never had a problem with any of them. It's very sharp very well designed. The thing I like best about it is, Black and Decker has multiple tools that use this battery so I can swap and use any one i want. I also have the weedeater, and the blower, and I have the 20volt chainsaw for small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite tools to use. I have a 14 acre horse farm that needs kept trimmed. I love this because it's not too heavy for me to work with. I 'm 5 ft 1... 120 pounds... and I can use it for hours and not get worn out. I think the battery pack lasts a good amount of time, too. I checked reviews on it before I got it. I'm glad I purchased it and I actually want another one so 2 of us can trim at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: truecountrygirl

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had read all the 1 star reviews.
customer_reviews.text: The hedge trimmer did always turn on out of the box. Very light use. Trimming ornamental grasses and 10 rose bushes. Never worked it hard. Yesterday battery didn't seem to be fully charged. Had to press switch this time 3 times. I smelled something the same time as the smoke started pouring out. I am done with Black & Decker. Thought I purchased the insurance. Looks like when I added an extra battery it did stay in my cart. My fault.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Ryan III

customer_reviews.title: Good no frill trimmer at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth running trimmer that does a good job. Relatively quiet. Works fine with after market compatible 40 volt battery. There are some quirks. The trimmer makes a chime sound when started. I don't understand the purpose of this feature. One minor annoyance is that debris tend to collect on the rail/bar of the trimmer. Finally, compare to a corded trimmer I had used, the cutting blades take a tad longer to come to a complete stop after the trigger is released.
customer_reviews.author: dallas guy

customer_reviews.title: A great trimmer and a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a go to trimmer. I've been using corded trimmers for many years. I wasn't sure about whether a 40 volt trimmer would have the power and speed I desired. Also my past experience has been with an 18 inch blade. Well, this one is a winner. It's easy to use, quick, powerful, and doesn't bog down cutting thick shrub branches. The best part with this trimmer is, I'm no longer burdened with a100 ft. extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Black & Decker Hedge Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I had already bought the Black & Decker 40v blower and edge trimmer and they worked so well I bought the hedge trimmer as well. The hedge trimmer actually does a better job than my old Black & Decker hedge trimmer that has a cord.
customer_reviews.author: Reid

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the average homeowner
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the Black and Decker product. My gas hedge trimmer finally gave out so I bought this model. I never had a battery operated one before but was very happy with the light weight and ease of cutting. It seems to have enough power although I have only run it for a little over an hour. I am only a homeowner and will trim my shrubs about 3 times a year. Glad I bought this item.
customer_reviews.author: RAF

customer_reviews.title: LONG LASTING batteries
customer_reviews.text: I can trim extra hedge or tree in my yard and I can't wear out both batteries. Awesome because I have about 15 small/medium hedges, 5 large (12 foot tall) hedges and 3 trees that require trimming about 4 times a year. Using both fully charged batteries, I have never come up short. As a matter of fact, I could use the batteries afterwards for my edge trimmer around my yard and my neighbors yard without having to recharge. I'm a FAN!!!
customer_reviews.author: floyd wesley jr

customer_reviews.title: Love these trimmers. Light weight, durable, and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: These hedge trimmers are unbelievable. I previously used gas powered trimmers and just holding them up was a job. These 40 volt cordless are 3 times lighter and work just as well ( I think better) than the gas powered one's. I have about 100' of Ligustrum shrubs that are fast growing and can get very large. These trimmers go through them like hot butter and leave a well finished manicured look. I also have about 30 feet of boxwoods in the front yard and they trim them equally as well. The best Thing!!! I can do the entire yard and still have 75% charge left in the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Taebaker

customer_reviews.title: If it fits, it cuts.
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed!!! I got this in the mail today & instantly threw an already charged battery in and went to work. This easily trimmed all of my hedges as if they were butter so I was done rather quickly... I grew curious and decided to tackle some vines & yearling trees in an overgrown area of my neighbors yard. Basically, if the opening was large enough, this was cutting it! I would up grinding down about a 300 sq ft area that was very overgrown and I still had battery remaining. Used it for about 45 minutes, maybe an hour... Wasn't planning to do near as much as I did but I enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Noodles

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye extension cord!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a corded hedge trimmer with this one and I am really happy with the switch! It is a lot easier to get to all sides of my house without relocating the cord. It's also easier to use because the cord isn't catching branches. (I may have accidentally cut said cord with the old trimmer... Oops) Plenty of power and lasts long enough to do my whole yard, including a pretty large row of hedges along the property line!
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Eliminates being tethered to a cord
customer_reviews.text: After decades of dragging 100 foot cords to power my hedge trimmer, it was a great improvement to have a battery operated tool. I really appreciate the 40 volt battery. My 20 volt edger and blower both feel underpowered next to this tool. Light enough for easy handling and still powerfully enough to cut through 1/2" branches.
customer_reviews.author: UncaDon

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to handle, sharp easily cut woody branches. One of the best tools I own!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I didn’t buy this earlier! Makes really fast work of trimming shrubs. I trimmed 6 arborvitae in just a couple of hours including cleanup and moving the ladder around! Before I always needed help but with this hedge trimmer I did it by myself (I’m a 63 year old petite woman). There was still battery left when I finished. I have the B&D leaf blower and string trimmer I like both of them and now the hedge trimmer!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie D. Baird

customer_reviews.title: Motor burns out quickly
customer_reviews.text: First one lasted a few months and then motor started smoking and stopped. Had good battery and charger so bought a new unit (without battery) and again after working for a short time it started smoking and quit working. Only used it to trim small bushes. Nearest B&D warranty service facility is 90 minutes away or alternatively I need to pay to ship to them for "repair or replacement" ... totally worthless since unit costs ~$50 without battery and ship cost is high. Lots of 5 star ratings on Amazon, but probably were given after first trying out trimmer and not after using it for awhile. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: TMA

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer for a homeowner
customer_reviews.text: This makes trimming so much easier! No cords to wrestle with, or cut (I have a collection of several repaired cords over the years). Battery holds a charge - I've never run it down yet, but I probably use only a hour at a time - and half that is picking the cutting up. I keep the battery in the basement, so it avoids extreme heat and cold in the garage - that should help longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Woehr

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and lots of power. This cordless unit trims much better than my electrical unit. The teeth are further apart, so I have not had anything get caught in the blades and I have not run out of power yet. When the battery was first inserted, I was anxious to try it. The battery came nearly fully discharged, yet the trimmer still had lots of power and did a great job trimming my hedges. It is light and has plenty of reach, and best of all I am not getting tangled in a long extension cord. I hightly recommend this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin CTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: For Now On, All my Tools will be Cordless
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic hedge cutter! I have had a much smaller, electrical one for years. It was always a pain to drag out the cord, constantly watch the cord, while still trying to cut the hedge. Not with this beauty. Light enough to reach out with it while staying running long enough to finish my bushes. Highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: E. Timmie

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I already had the 40 v battery for my B& D string trimmer so ordered this to go with it after my gas powered trimmer quit working for the third time. I spent more each time getting it serviced than this cost. To my surprise it works as well as the gas model on light to medium work. Have not tried it on chewing trough thicker wood but the blades seem very sharp. It is lighter and that helps if you have a lot to cut. Good product so far!
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Radio Man Jim
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I am really glad I purchased this B&D cordless trimmer. The double action blades really cut the heavy stuff, and I can do my hedges in just half the time it normally took. What is amazing is the battery. I can trim all my hedges and bushes and the battery still has power left. This trimmer is fantastic!!!! Thanks B&D for building a good reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Radio Man Jim

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker 40V cordless Hedge Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I love this cordless hedge clipper. I cut branches thicker than my old gas powered craftsman hedge clipper. It also weighs about half and is much easier to handle. I have used it for 30 minutes at a time easily on one charge and have not yet drained the battery. I like that the battery has a lighted gauge that tells you how much charge remains. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pharmer Norm

customer_reviews.title: No more cutting extension cords :-)
customer_reviews.text: I've been using an older corded hedge trimmer and cut two extension cords accidentally. We have a big yard requiring plugging in the cord in different outlets and trying to avoid cutting a third cord.... The battery charges quickly and lasted the whole back yard. My arms gave out before the battery (The trimmer is not very heavy but the vibrations made my arms tingle). It took me half the time to finish all the trimmings. Love my new tool!
customer_reviews.author: MJR

customer_reviews.title: Works effectively on big jobs and small
customer_reviews.text: I first used this to cut a hedge that had not been trimmed all summer. It performed quite well with trimming back the overgrowth. I have also used it to cut down perennials at the end of summer. As stated in the information about the hedge trimmer it cannot handle branches that are 3/4" thick, which can be cut with loppers. My only problem with the trimmer is that it is difficult for me to get the battery to snap into place and stay.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, Long Duration Battery Enhances the High Quality TrimingTool
customer_reviews.text: After my old trimmer broke down, I wanted to find a battery powered trimmer that had used the same battery system to power other tools that I plan to get later. The 40 volt Black and Decker trimmer checked all the boxes and after several uses I am very happy with my purchase. A tall 50 foot overgrown hedge was no match for the trimmer and battery.
customer_reviews.author: Mojoco.

customer_reviews.title: B&D 40 volt hedge trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts a long time. Struggles with anything 1/2 inch dia or greater. Easier and quicker to use a lopper for 1/2 inch plus. Does great on smaller diameter. I used it and am using it along with other tools to severely prune large azaleas (Pride of Mobile etc). I have a 20 volt that works well on really small diameter and this one is more powerful but not as good as claimed.
customer_reviews.author: Will D Beast

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I was skeptical of a battery powered hedge trimmer, but I was wrong! This is a game changer. I have used a corded hedge trimmer in the past and cut the cord in half one time. I hated the cord. For the last four years, I have used a manual hedge trimmer that took forever and wore me out. This beauty cuts through thick hedges like a hot knife through butter. No exaggeration. This is one of the best purchases I have made in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. Deutsch

customer_reviews.title: My Black & Decker Hedge Trimmer works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Really do like the weight and response of this hedge trimmer...My arms don't fall off after using this trimmer for awhile. Cuts thru all of my shrubs and small trees just as I hoped it would...Battery lasts for quite some time after a full charge...Really the best tool I've purchased in a long time....
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned by some reviewers who said the battery didn't last very long. I have a LOT of shrubs over a 2 acre lot that need pruning a couple of times a year. I've used this trimmer three times now and find the battery gives me well over an hour, then recharges quickly. Because of the battery composition, you can leave it on the charger continuously without battery deterioration. Only downside is that it tends to heat up when using for fifteen minutes or so; I stop and give it a rest while I clean up the debris. That way it seems to fit my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: KY Yankee Fan

customer_reviews.title: Po at werful and battery lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.text: This cordless trimmer has a long blade, and the battery lasts long enough to do all the trimming of my 1/4Acre in-town lot! I used to have to do in two steps because the battery didn't last long enough to finish my lot. It cuts through pretty tough shrubbery with ease, just like advertised. Black and Decker has done it again - I love their products! Their 24V line trimmer is also a GREAT product! Trims and EDGES beautifully, just turn the head and edge even through tough weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Wenger6

customer_reviews.title: Ok.  It's perfect except the for cutting.
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight, the safety features, the battery life...but..... The trimmed branches looked a lot more chewed than I imagined. I've been using pruners for years (read: One branch at a time.) so perhaps I'm just unfamiliar with what a hedge trimmer can and can not do..... Anyway, it sure makes an old hour long job seem like a 15 minute breeze. So I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Endoredil

customer_reviews.title: The jury is out
customer_reviews.text: The unit is well balanced but does not cut privet hedges cleanly. Battery lasts a long time and unit is nicely balanced. After only the second use the unti failed. The battery was fully charged and seated properly. If I would turn the unit upside down it would turn on and then immediately shut off. Removing and replacing battery did not change the symptom. Amazon with their wonderful, reliable warranty service is replacing the unit. I hope this was a one time manufacturers defect and I do not have a repeat problem. The 3 yr product warranty may have to be counted upon
customer_reviews.author: Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hedger that is really easy to use. Cuts through small bushes easily to make your landscape looking great! The battery charges really quickly and it comes with a charger. It uses a 40v battery and it has enough juice to get me through my gardening every time. I don't have too many bushes to trim, but I never have any issues with changing the battery. I won't cut through larger branches as described in the manual. Not heavy at all. Great tool for the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through like it was butter
customer_reviews.text: I got some very large hedges and I took this trimmer and went through all of them like butter. I also competed more hedges in my back yard that were about 8 yards in length. The trimmer motor got pretty hot so let it cool off periodical to keep it from burning up the motor. My battery only lasted about 1.5 hours but I was pretty much non-stop on some heavy hedges. So will try to edit this post again late Fall when I do some more cutting.
customer_reviews.author: MR B

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I always used a corded machine.when it expired I thought I would try this battery operated unit. I love it. At fiber I thought it may be too heavy but I was wrong. The blades art linger and at 5’tall I need The extra length, I found it just as sharp and more efficient and I didn’t have to worry about the cord. I will buy other battery operated products as a result of my satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Powerful trimmer perfect for the homeowner
customer_reviews.text: I love this trimmer - it cuts through difficult shrubs like a hot knife through butter......it is also light weight and can easily be controlled with one hand......I've never burned through a battery on one job. Just be aware that it is light weight because their is a lot of plastic used - so I don't think it would be good for pro use......but for me a homeowner it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: KGXG

customer_reviews.title: Even a small woman can handle this trimmer with ease.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a small person (112 lbs.) and we have a lot of grasses and bushes that grow very fast around our our house. I need trim about every other week to keep the yard looking nice. I wanted a power trimmer that I could handle to do the work so I went on line for help. I ordered the trimmer and an extra battery. I was shocked at how well I could handle this trimmer and had fun to boot. I love my trimmer and tell all my neighbors and friends how great it is... but I don’t lend it out.
customer_reviews.author: Saltlakemama

customer_reviews.title: Fire Possibility
customer_reviews.text: The 40-Volt High Performance Cordless Hedge Trimmer stopped working and when the battery was removed to evaluate the problem, smoke and the strong of electrical fire occurred in the battery docking port. The trimmer stopped working and the battery no longer holds a charge. BLACK+DECKER Customer service has not returned my secondary email re the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: I already had 40 volt bateries for my B&D weed trimmer. Which I have been happy with. It's 4 years old and still working great. So this hedge trimmer seemed like a no brainer. I was not disappointed. Battery life was good. I trimmed all od the hedges in front of my house one battery died and the other finished the job no problem. If someone says this trimmer is not heavy duty enough then they are using it for the wrong application. Very happy with this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great, but maybe it should have more safety features.
customer_reviews.text: Really good cordless hedge trimmer. I’ve used this to cut down virtually all forms of brush and weeds and twigs. It’s light and maneuverable. My only gripe is that it seems too easy to keep running which leaves me feeling it’s not totally safe. I leave the battery out when I’m not using it to avoid anyone accidentally getting hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Mr and Mrs Up

customer_reviews.title: Performance plus....
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer holds a charge and doesn't take long to recharge. It's lightweight, sharp and extremely easy to work with. It honestly exceeded my expectations. It easily handles my arborvitaes, yews and boxwoods.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmer I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This hedge trimmer is amazing. It is light weight and powerful. I can walk down my road and cut back all the branches and brush hanging out. The battery lasts a minimum of two hours and I use a DC to AC converter in the truck and while the battery is charging, which takes less than an hour, I clean up the mess I left behind. By the time I am done the battery is charged and I'm ready to pick up where I left off. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Labrat

customer_reviews.title: I remember when Black and Decker used to have GOOD stuff
customer_reviews.text: When the unit works it is servicable and light weight. Decent battery life. However, the one I bought in 2016 stopped running in May of 2018. Ok, for $110 I simply bought another in May 2018. This way I have two batteries and chargers. The 2018 one lasted two months of weekly light hedge trimming. The main sprocket broke. It is under warranty, BUT I have to drive 70 miles to a service center or use the pre paid mailing label from B&D. Either way, no trimmer for weeks or months. I remember when Black and Decker used to have GOOD stuff
customer_reviews.author: Golf nut

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great, super battery life. I included a photo of a trailer full of debris. Other than the few big limbs you can see (which I used to compress the cuttings and keep them on the trailer), I cut this trailer full of salal, wild blackberry canes, and wild rose bushes on a single battery charge. Did two more trailer loads today. Charges fast too. BTW - I am over 65, 5’4” with a lot of hand arthritis and it was easy for even me to use.
customer_reviews.author: Island Mom

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my first one that lasted only about a year but that was from over use and abuse on my part. This time I will use the proper tool for the job and this trimmer will see lighter use and should last much longer than my first one. The 40 volt battery gives this trimmer all the power you need and lasts a long time on each charge.
customer_reviews.author: Zane

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent battery life and very sharp. I used it on over 200 feet of ligustrum hedge with battery to spare. I recommend actually Reading the manual, (I know guys...) because I got some good tips on effective and efficient ways to make a straight and level hedge.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like buttah
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a smaller corded trimmer that was awkward to use. We had other B&D 40V tools so stuck with this model. Took it after an ivy covered wall, about 200 sq ft total, and quickly trimmed off two big yard waste carts full and only used 1/2 the battery charge. Never had a problem handling the 24" blade, and it's well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Much Faster
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a corded hedge trimmer for years and always kept more of an eye on the cord than the trimming. It was nice being able to focus on the symmetry and not accidentally cutting a cord. Having a B+D cordless weed whacker also helped making the decision as the battery can be switched between the two without issue.
customer_reviews.author: xvrickh

customer_reviews.title: Impressive battery hedge trimmers
customer_reviews.text: I rated a four only because it's not gas. I received the hedge trimmers and it had a defective battery, called Amazon, I was told to keep the old ones, don't return and new trimmers were being sent. The new trimmers cut awesome! It slices through a fairly thick branch no problem. Very light weight and quite. Impressive battery operated hedge trimmers.
customer_reviews.author: E. Humphries

customer_reviews.title: best battery trimmer I have used.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the double action blades. Most trimmers one blade is stationary and one moves. On this trimmer both move giving more of a scissor cut. It definitely cuts smoother and faster. This comes with the fast charger instead of the clip charger that is included with many B&D 40V tools. The clip charger takes 6+ hours to charge in my experience, so this fast charger is a huge advantage as it charges in about an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Pictureman

customer_reviews.title: Like buttah
customer_reviews.text: only used it for about 20 mins my first day but it cut my shrubs like a hot knife through butter. i had borrowed neighbors' trimmers before and thought this would be the same. no comparison. maybe theirs cut like this when new, dont know....but this made no effort at all to cut standard shrubs and a forcithia bush (they have thick stalky branches). i found the 6.8lbs lightweight and very maneuverable compared to theirs. the 20 mins didnt make a dent on the 40v 1.5 milliamp/hour battery.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power and light weight!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by how light this is. This tool is well balanced and easy to use. It delivers great power. I have never had it run out of battery in the 2 months I have owned it. It makes trimming hedges very easy, especially not being tied to an extension cord. I am very happy with this purchase, and I would highly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this hedge trimmer!  Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The battery recharges in about an hour or less. I use it for keeping my hedge looking nice, so it is only cutting through branches about 1/4 inch thick. Got my 60 foot hedge done in under an hour without needing to recharge the battery. Much easier to use than my old electric trimmer and no worries about cutting through my extension cord or tripping on it. Am an older woman and this trimmer is very light and was easy for me to maneuver. It's a WINNER!
customer_reviews.author: Debby

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Get Service Support from Black& Decker
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for first year (purchased in October 2018); now, battery fully charged, battery charger fully functioning; nothing caught in blades, but, battery, correctly inserted, beeps and trimmer does not work. Tried 4 times to register issue with Black & Decker customer support, website continuously shows error and will not accept my complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Waite

customer_reviews.title: Super Time Saver. Great Balance
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a time saver! Much larger than my old electric trimmer, more powerful, and it can accommodate much larger limbs than before. The battery charges very quickly, which would be convenient to someone trimming tons of bushes. Most times, my battery still indicates a full charge after doing all my yard work. This trimmer plows through my trimming jobs. I've cut limbs up to 1/2" thick and the trimmer doesn't even hesitate, it just keeps going. No struggling. The trimmer also has great balance between the weight of the battery + motor and the long trimming blade.
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product about a year ago and the motor has burned out last evening. The same thing happened to my previous unit. If it were reliable it would get 5 stars. But now I need to return it under warranty, and hope they'll replace it. what I really don't understand is why the manufacturer doesn't use a self resetting circuit breaker to protect the motor. it couldn't cost more than a dollar. or maybe the motor winding just shorts out? in my case I didn't abuse the unit or cause the motor to stall. Black+Decker can't make any money if the hedge trimmer keeps failing. don't they look at the return numbers?
customer_reviews.author: w08833

AMAZON.COM


The LHT2436 dual-action hedge trimmer. It's powered by BLACK+DECKER's high-powered 40-volt lithium battery system, which offers power, excellent runtime, and the versatility to share batteries with other tools within the system. 

THE LITHIUM ADVANTAGE
BLACK+DECKER's 40-volt lithium-ion system offers numerous benefits over older battery technologies and gas options, notably the ability to put more power into a small and compact battery. Lithium batteries have a longer lifecycle than other types, and they also hold their charge longer when taken off the charger. This means that once charged, a lithium battery is always ready to use. The included Energy Star-rated fast charger fully recharges the battery in about 1 hour.

CUTTING POWER AND CONVENIENCE

It's enough to cut through branches up to 3/4-inch thick. The LHT2436 features a full wrap-around front handle provides a comfortable gripping area in all cutting orientations (and is large enough to accommodate gloves), soft rubber grip, and a built-in cord retention system to avoid accidental unplugging.
